alert.note: Alert for Bland; Grayson; Smyth; Tazewell; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 8:44AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Alleghany and northeastern Ashe Counties in northwestern North Carolina, Pulaski, Smyth, west central Floyd, southeastern Tazewell, southern Bland, Carroll, Wythe, Grayson and southwestern Patrick Counties in southwestern Virginia and the City of Galax through 915 AM EDT... At 844 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rural Retreat, moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pulaski... Wytheville... Galax... Bland... Marion... Hillsville... and Dublin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
